column4: ara> when Kino talk about avi files, I believe it is referring to DV format content hosted inside the avi format ( the other formats require libraries that can decode microsoft avi formats )
wweasel> once it's chmod-ed, you can give it a try with ./script_name
wweasel> if it works, you can create a launcher that points to the script
kestas> totem-gstreamer doesn't make use of the 32bit libraries that xine/mplayer do, and thus cannot decode the WMV video.
kestas> have a look at xine's audio configuration.
wweasel> had that earlier today too.  did you copy into that script file the entire little script from the web page?
tonyyarusso> i would think that's an X-window option?>
xsmogx> does ls /usr/local/bin/aim list the file correctly?  is it executable?
wweasel> still with you -- just reading the page over.  does the file /etc/pango32/pangorc exist on your syste,?
xsmogx> the tar file has expanded itself in the current directory.  you will have to move it to its final location
intelikey: I was hoping all of them, but I'm ignorant like that.  So far I've been using it in XChat, Firefox, and gnome-terminal.
Do you know where I would change it if it is an X thing?
(Well, I suppose xorg.conf somewhere, but where in / how?)
I found the mouse section in xorg.conf, but don't know how I would modify it.  Is there a guide to dealing with this file somewhere?
Where did you get this answer?

Not every app has configurations for that though.  Do I just have to tough it out for those, or do the 4 5 mean something along the lines of a default to use in that situation?  (Checking out the link now.)
Ah, missing the l at the end.  We're good now.
